title: Preseason 6 Items found in Match History
body:
Check the Match History "Player Builds" tab if you don't believe :)

#Starting items

Keep in mind players will start with 500 gold.

* Doran's Ring has 50% mana regen
* Doran's Blade cost up to 450: has 8 AD, 80 HP, 3% lifesteal
* Doran's Shield cost up to 450
* **New item - [Cull](http://i.imgur.com/q2hAfN0.png)**: 5 AD, 3 life on hit, +1 gold pre minion kill; killing 100 minions grants bonus 300g and disables that passive.
* **New item - [The Dark Seal](http://i.imgur.com/C0rny8q.png)**, basically a mini-Mejais that doesnt give you health or mana regen like Doran's Ring does, but allows you to stack a decent chunk of AP on kills. Builds into Mejai's Soulstealer.
* Hunter's Machete has an onhit damage scaling with AS now (again)
* **New item - Hunter's Medallion**: more similar to the current Machete, grants significant mana regen
* Tier 1 jungle items cost 350 gold (you can afford the new refillable potion with them)

#Components

* Long Sword costs 350g (down from 360)
* B. F. Sword costs 1400g (down from 1550) and grants 40 AD (down from 50)
* Cloak of Aglity costs 800, grants 20% crit; Brawler's Gloves grant 10% crit
* Dagger costs 300g, grants 12% AS
* Rejuventation Bead costs 150g
* Faerie Charm costs 125g
* Sapphire Crystal costs 350g and grants 250 mana

#Consumables

* Health Potions cost 50g (up from 35g)
* Mana Potions removed. Champions who used to buy them have their mana regen increased.
* Stealth Wards removed
* Vision Wards cost 75g (down from 100g)
* Elixirs cost 500g (up from 400g) and have their effects appropriately enhanced
* Crystalline Flask removed? Possibly stays, but can't find it
* New consumables (only one potion allowed):
 * Refillable Potion (150g): Restores 100 hp over 10 seconds (2 charges, refills at fountain). Upgrades into the other potions.
 * Corrupting Potion (500g): Restores 150 hp and 50 mana over 12 seconds and grants your spells a small DoT burn for the duration (3 charges, refills at fountain)
 * Hunter's Potion (400g): Restores 60 hp and 35 mana over 8 seconds. (5 charges, refills at fountain; large monster kills will refill one charge)

---

#Advanced components

* Crystalline Bracer cost up to 650g
* Chain Vest cost up to 800g
* **Sheen does not build out of Amplifying Tome anymore, grants 250 mana and 10% CDR instead**
* Recurve Bow grants 25% AS (down from 30), cost down to 1000g
* Stinger grants 50% AS (up from 40)
* Vampric Scepter costs a bit more, grants 15 AD and 10% lifesteal
* **The Brutalizer is gone**, split into two 25 AD items:
 * Serrated Dirk has 10 armor penetration
 * Caulfield's Warhammer has 10% CDR
* Zeal has 15% AS and 20% crit
* **New item - [Jaurim's Fist](http://i.imgur.com/9TYExZi.png)**: like Seeker's Armguard, but for AD+HP. Builds Sterak's Gage, Titanic Hydra and Frozen Mallet. WARMOGS STACKING HEALTH IS BACK BABY
* **New item - [Kircheis Shard](http://i.imgur.com/OuAlOM8.png)**: Dagger upgrade, builds into charge-based items like Statikk Shiv
* Last Whisper has only 25 AD, costs way less, penetrates bonus armor, not total, and builds into two new items
* Forbidden Idol costs 550g (down from 600), some small similar changes
* Hexdrinker: cost down, shield scales with level
* Tiamat builds out of Pickaxe + Rejuvenation Bead, has only 30 AD but costs way less
* New 10 AD advanced component "[Giant Slayer](https://i.imgur.com/r1AGziI.jpg)" that gives bonus % damage vs targets with higher health than you, builds into one of the two LW upgrades
* [Executioner's Calling](https://i.imgur.com/bia4Qk6.jpg) comes back as a component item, builds into the other LW upgrade
* Avarice Blade removed - they tried having it build into something, but it did not work out
* Tier 2 jungle items build out of the two starting jungle items
* **Poacher's Knife replaced with Tracker's Knife, which is a mini-Sightstone** with two wards max.
* (Tier 3 jungle items are unchanged)

---

#AD items

* IE down to 65 AD
* Essence Reaver has 65 AD, 20% crit, 10% CDR, restores mana on critical strikes and grants up to 20% CDR from crit from outside sources
* BT down to 75 AD
* Mercurial Scimitar has lifesteal now
* Statikk Shiv deals bonus damage to minions
* **New item - [Rapid Firecannon](http://i.imgur.com/162Kd6S.png)**, identical in buildpath to Shiv, but instead of waveclear grants you bonus attack range when fully charged
* Runaan's Hurricane builds out of Zeal and can crit
* Phantom Dancer reduces damage from the last target you've autoattacked
* Youmuu's Ghostblade no longer grants crit; builds out of the two Brutalizer replacements
* **New item - [Death's Dance](http://i.imgur.com/E05Yvrq.png)**: 65 AD, 10% CDR, spellvamp from physical damage, 20% incoming damage is delayed as bleed. (yes Riven mains just came)
* Last Whisper upgrades (keep in mind they have BONUS armor penetration now):
 * [Lord Dominik's Regards](http://i.imgur.com/4o9vxnK.png) - bonus damage to enemies with higher HP than you
 * [Mortal Reminder](http://i.imgur.com/2t6zav5.png) - applies Grievous Wounds
* BotRK slightly nerfed (6% from 8% onhit, +200g cost)

#Fighter items

* Black Cleaver builds out of Warhammer instead of Kindlegem; grants 55 AD and 300 HP
* Maw of Malmortius grants +25% AS, +10% lifesteal and +10% spellvamp when the shield triggers
* Minor Rageblade, Gunblade, Frozen Mallet changes; Rageblade seems really strong on Kayle and Jax
* Trinity Force no longer grants AP, has 10% CDR instead
* Wit's End is still useless

#Tank items

* Nerfs across the board to account for the nerf to Last Whisper.
* Cost of most armor items goes up by a tiny bit, sometimes paired with increased armor, but not always.
* Banshee's Veil and Spirit Visage now have 500 HP and 70 MR.
* Warmog's has 850 HP up from 800.
* No changes to Ohmwrecker. I guess they've stopped trying.

#Mage items

* All 3000g items now cost 3200g
* Deathcap costs 3800g
* RoA cost up to 3200g
* Archangel cost up to 3100g
* Nashor's Tooth has 50% AS
* Lichbane has now 10% CDR (Sheen change)
* Staff of the Flowing Water (item from Black Market Brawlers) seems to be back

It seems the gold income might have gone up globally. Or just are items are equally more expensive.

#Support items

* Relic Shield now has flat GP10
* Frostfang now grants 100% mana regen
* Talisman line has lost flat MS
* FotM active no longer deals damage on shield explosion, slows the enemies instead
* FQC active replaced with the Twin Shadows active; Twin Shadows removed
* New Sightstone upgrades: Eye of the Equinox, Eye of the Oasis, Eye of the Watchers. Basically nothing more than Sightstone combined with the stats of the GP10 item, retaining the gold passive.
* Ruby Sightstone grants reduced CD on activated items. Masteries no longer reduce CD of items.
* Mikael's Crucible: cheaper, 5 less MR
* Aegis of the Legion: cheaper, 5 less MR in aura

---

If you want more details, just check your own match history :)

replies.body: I feel like it's going to be an "Everyone but junglers and supports start Cull meta"

> [{quoted}](name=OperationDEEZ1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bo7hxGEj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-10-29T03:40:27.468+0000)
>
> I feel like it's going to be an "Everyone but junglers and supports start Cull meta"

Huehue :3 {{champion:41}} taking all da gold, after all, he's a pirate!
yeah, seeing as {{item:3093}} is going to be removed, i'll need to find another way to start my maximum greed build

Cull still seems decent on junglers, but you will have to keep it until lategame. I can see myself buying it at first back if I can afford it with my jungle item. Then again **potion that refills on monster kills** _drools_
BUT AT WHAT COST?! {{item:3070}} {{item:3093}} {{item:3070}}

You get a fixed amount of profit from it, since from the passive and selling it you only make 130 gold. You can make more gold by having lane dominance granted by a stronger earlygame item like dorans blade, or even a longsword and potions.
Rip aegis 10 mr won't do jack
RIP mages. Marksmen will do your jobs much better than you can, now that Riot decided that they should be hyper buffed (while nerfing every other position).

> [{quoted}](name=Lafouboy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bo7hxGEj,comment-id=0017,timestamp=2015-10-29T08:03:27.588+0000)
>
> RIP mages. Marksmen will do your jobs much better than you can, now that Riot decided that they should be hyper buffed (while nerfing every other position).

"MAGES ARE DEAD THIS SEASON FOR SURE!"

-mage mains every season since season 2

Corki now does tons magic damage on auto attack (which he lifesteals off of and can crit on) and on his kits' abilities. He also has a pseudo Rumble ult that gives homeguard buff + 2 dashes (one insanely long range that can go straight into his second dash) during "special deliveries". Then you also have to remember how much they are switching the items to suit these ADCs/help them (with all of them being much cheaper than the items mages can pick up).

And this is only one of the many marksmen Riot has decided they would buff (hyper buff if you count the itemization they now have + the nerfs on other roles' items).

Mages weren't dead any of the other times people said they would be, they won't be dead soon either. ADCs don't replace or kill mages because they don't occupy the same niche as mages. You listed the only ADC whose heavy focus is going to be on that magic damage. As opposed to the others who have their own more-defined niche now - you chose the one whose focus is outright said to be magic damage. 

This isn't going to kill mages. I don't even know which mage you think it's going to kill. "RIP mages" is incredibly broad.

Mages DID die for a time when they gutted mana regen items. It was basically {{champion:238}} vs {{champion:157}} vs {{champion:55}} every game in midlane for like a month. They they fixed Athene's and everything went back to normal.

Damn, the new Tri force is now even more of a gimmick on Morde.
Nerfed the MS, AD and AS
Buffed Crit and mana
Removed AP
 <_<
All I know is that anti adc comps are coming up and these triforces buffs helps my favorite pony {{champion:120}} dive those lines.

Morde didn't build {{item:3078}} anymore anyway. Now it's more like {{item:3116}} {{item:3111}} for it's core. After that he mostly goes tank or full AP. Why would you go tri-force if you can perma slow enemies with your dragon.

Wait, you don't even  get mana sustain unless you spend all your starting gold on a flask?

That is the stupidest thing ever.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bo7hxGEj,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2015-10-29T06:45:24.664+0000)
>
> Wait, you don't even  get mana sustain unless you spend all your starting gold on a flask?
> 
> That is the stupidest thing ever.

aside from a few champions who built flask. who got mana potions at level one? and the ones that got flask already spent almost all thier gold on it anyways.

mage supports (sona, janna, lulu, etc) buy mana pots at start. This will hurt them pretty bad unless riot delivers on their promise to relieve mana issues during preseason.

Also Diana.

If your spamming your abilities to the point you need to drink a mana potion your playing support wrong. getting the mana regen masteries with a spellthief is enough mana regen as long as you don't spam your abilities. Your gonna get more lane time with a health pot than you are gonna get with a mana bot as any of those supports. not to mention most supports have the biscuit anyway so they get health anyways for the upgrade.

Maybe it's just my ELO but with sona I almost always burn through my mana trying to keep my adc alive. Maybe if they actually upped the healing on her w or reduced the mana cost it wouldn't be nearly as bad, but fuck sona amirite

The people who say things like "just don't spam your abilities" are usually said by players who typically play solo lanes, or when forced into a support role will play kill supports that rarely use their skills until it's time to burst someone down. They aren't generally playing a champion that's expected to do certain things that don't involve killing the enemy and they can't understand why people can have mana issues in the beginning of the game.  For instance, the guy you're having the argument with spams Leona for his support role and has a game with Ryze (who builds Tear early). Is it any wonder he doesn't get the problem?

Actually a support who can effectively harass by spamming will allow adc to farm and easily take lane. I don't enjoy being supported by a champ who just runs around taking it easy and acting as a distraction  only.

That's all fine till the support runs out of mana and then you have to rely on summoners to keep you alive due to having no mana. or the support going back alone and leaving you alone for the enemy to push you completely out of lane or kill you.

I'm not saying a support shouldn't poke or cause damage. but if your spamming your abilities even if you land a hit on everyone of them. your gonna be OOM before they get pushed out of lane.

Spell thief  has +25/100/150% mana regen from +25/50/50% mana regen

Sona uses this, Janna uses this, Lulu uses this. 

They put more mana regen into spell thief to compensate for missing mana pots for supports.
Did you just say Janna uses spell thief's edge?

>Nerfs across the board to account for the nerf to Last Whisper.

It's good to know that Riot still despises tanks.
Rotational roster of champions "Sejuani and Sion were OP for a while because Cinderhulk, so we'll keep them nerfed for the next two years" at its finest.

I wouldn't even call the nerf to Last Whisper an actual nerf since it gets to build into something now. The former god of gold efficiency will probably end up being 1/2 the new god of gold efficiency.
Well, about half a year ago, everyone thought they loved them. Strange.
Shitload of ad nerfs but Zhonya untouched? Riot pls..
Zhonyas is nerfed,  -20 AP, -5 Armor, +200 gold.
Nobody cares about its base stats, active alone is worth 4000 gold.
If the active was worth 4k everyone would build it and it would be the first item every mid would buy.
Full AP {{champion:238}} , LETS GO

And mobility is worth  infinite gold. 

Guess which one cant be bought ingame?

Wow you are still updating this. Remind me. To check back later when you get more info!

____________________________________

Uhhhh All this stuff I need to re-do ALL of my builds..
Season 6 is going to start off so complicated. Worse than last year
This.
RIP Mages, RIP Tanks. Welcome to the AD Meta. Assassin+Bruiser+ADC circlejerk slaughterfest every game where everyone dies in 1-2 hits.

Yep. All AD all the time. Fighters, bruisers, Devourer junglers, juggernauts, ADCs, AD assassins all get insane buffs from these items and mastery changes.

Just the sheer volume of healing they get now from items that are (or will be) standard across the board is mindblowing. Lifesteal masteries with lifesteal starting items with lifesteal core AD items and lifesteal procs from all kinds of other items. Now with the added bonus of lifestealing from physical damage abilities and total immunity to assassination. What the actual fuck.

I'm pretty concerned with two things : Rapid Firecannon seems broken as fuck (2500 gold for **increased range**, 30% critical strike and attack speed , plus a 50-200 on-hit magic damage? Wut?) and Last Whisper, despite filling more his niche, seems to make squishy champions even stronger and bruisery/tank champions even weaker (phantom dancer also gives them improved duelling)
[guess I'll keep playing Master Yi]

Otherwise, Botrk nerf -> FINALLY YEEEEEESSSSSSSSSS
5 attacks per second for Kog'maw W with reduced damage but full on-hit -> this looks freaking scary
Graves -> reload system seems weird, especially that you apparently can't reload if there's nothing to attack (???)
Trinity with cdr -> interesting
5 seconds Grievous wounds applied on autoattacks -> Oh well, people wanted grievous wounds, but isn't this a bit too easy and too strong of a counter against specific champions? ({{champion:50}} {{champion:36}} )
Rageblade gives on-hit based on AD and AP -> interesting possible builds for Jax/Kayle/Xin? But you need full stacks for the on-hit to appear :s
Straight up buff on the magic resist items? errrrr
Keep in mind Firecannon is not a persistent effect. It only applies to Energized attacks.

> [{quoted}](name=Pyro,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bo7hxGEj,comment-id=001a0000,timestamp=2015-10-29T11:26:20.125+0000)
>
> Keep in mind Firecannon is not a persistent effect. It only applies to Energized attacks.

What I wonder is if just moving the slightest bit will instantly make the next attack energized or you have to move a lot/attack a bunch to make the next attack energized (slow charging like statikk). Because every decent ADC knows how to hit and run, making every autoattack energized if it's the first option.
I would say its exactly like the current Statikk Shiv, just different passive.

So if sightstone gets an upgrade with tier 2 supp items, does that mean we no longer build the full supp item or do we have to buy the same item two times: one for the sightstone upgrade and the other for the full supp item?
Sorry for the noob question.

> [{quoted}](name=SonicZephyr,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Bo7hxGEj,comment-id=002a,timestamp=2015-10-29T14:55:15.969+0000)
>
> So if sightstone gets an upgrade with tier 2 supp items, does that mean we no longer build the full supp item or do we have to buy the same item two times: one for the sightstone upgrade and the other for the full supp item?
> Sorry for the noob question.

You don't *have* to upgrade the Sightstone with the support item, you're still free to leave it as is or upgrade it into Ruby Sightstone. You can either build the Sightstone/Gold Item fusion or the fully upgraded Gold Item. You won't get both because you can only have one gold income item.

Think of the tier 2 support items like any items that can upgrade into multiple things.

wait did i read this right...no more spooky ghosts??

no more spooky ghosts =(
Spooky **icy** ghosts now. FQC has the Twin Shadows active.
I was sorta hoping the brought back {{item:3844}} {{item:3841}} and {{item:3840}}, they were really cool on supports that promote an aggressive lane that don't benefit from AP as much

> Wit's End is still useless


Hahahahaha
